runs.comm: starts with some movement and zip, nipping slightly away down the off-side
pushed on to the back foot, squared up a little bit too, the ball nips away again off the seam
Zimbabwe off the mark with a pull to midwicket - a sloppy throw from Pietersen whose fielding in the one-dayers with India wasn't always top notch either
drops his length back, moves it away, prompting a huge drive through cover drive
down that corridor again, rising steeply as it flies through at throat height
a huge outside edge from an attempted pull flies way over the lone slip's head and races on its way, a merry way in fact, all the way
wide, and heading wider, outside off - but very late swing, so he gets away with it
driven into the covers and Taylor is away with a quick single
outside off, cracking cut behind point on one knee
moving in, up there, pushed into the covers
outside off and launched over the covers for a big, flat six off the back foot
middled through mid-on. Glorious shot
misdirected down leg, Sibanda offers a disdainful turn away off the legs, doesn't connect with bat and the ball runs through fine leg
contacts this time, with the turn off the hips
straighter - outside off - played firmly off the back foot to wide third man where a non-wide Anderson returns with a smooth throw
wider of the crease and a wider ball results - and England will be grateful for a dot
on middle, launched in front of midwicket with a sweet click on the front foot - that would have rocketed to the boundary on a truer pitch, as it was, the ball made it with only relative comfort
a whoosh with minimal footwork - the ball flies through to Prior
finds the spot immediately, Taylor strong in front-foot defence
following him as Taylor moves back, defended on the back foot
slinked through and 'Oohs' result as Taylor flashes at a sharp one, moving back and away
an easy single into the covers this time
on middle and leg, a tad short, and swivel-pulled without being properly timed in front of square
nipped in at the right hander and Flintoff sends in a very late appeal indeed - he knew he didn't have a chance with that one
short, gives himself room to chop up and away through third man - a diving Anderson does his best, but his best isn't good enough here
up and over, a clever shot, playing with the height and the pace and lifting it off the bottom of the bat very straight behind the wicket
a dink-and-run into short midwicket
on middle and leg and with just enough room to pick off his toes and chip deliberately and strongly through midwicket
better, worked into short midwicket for a quick single
outside off, cut to point and they risk a single - a direct shy from Maddy at the non-striker's end would have been close
on leg, worked into short midwicket and how do you like your singles? Scrambled, in this case
just overpitches, and an easy on-drive punch brings up a four and the fifty
finds his line and a better length, the ball nipping in and zipping out to cover this time
just outside off now, the ball run down for a single where Schofield tidies up
intelligent delivery, full ball on off-and-middle, and driven into the ground towards the bowler
angling down leg now, excellent swivel pull off the back foot and that races away
quick single towards point, good running
tighter delivery, and the ball can only be trapped
short and with width outside off, flat-batted up and over mid-off
width again and a similar, but firmer, club over mid-off - but it plugs two yards inside the boundary
outside off, cut behind point off the back foot and another zippy run
just outside off, dinked towards cover and the pair set off immediately
on off to begin with, cut out to cover
on off, worked off the back foot into the covers
driven straight to long-on
eased into the covers
outside off, cut right into the ground
on leg and some great fielding from Anderson, who is as tidy as ever, somehow he caught it and then was able to drag it back in before the momentum carried him over for six
no doubt that that one was a six, however, a flat-bat from Taylor right over square
outside off, comes over to meet it and steals a quick'un
outside off, cut away to cover
outside off and goes straight in the air, Sibanda looking to go for the pull shot one too many times and the top edge is  taken easily enough at cover
outside off again and waited before wristing wide behind point
in trouble immediately, coming forward to meet the ball which curls naughtily away from him, but survives
backs away to dig a straight one to mid-off
good loop from Schofield, but a patient drive to mid-off
driven out straight to long-on for an easy one
pushed off the toes in front of square
a missed stumping there by Prior - Taylor's head was raised and he was way out of his crease after missing the drive
poked forward to round off another good over from Schofield
pushed out to midwicket for another single
that's the breakthrough, and a very timely one from England's point of view. Mascarenhas dropped it on a length as ever, Taibu went for a big swing across the line, and under-edged onto his stumps
full-length and driven into the covers
nurdled into the gap to bring the main man, Taylor, back on strike
lovely length, Taylor is drawn forward and defends resolutely
pushed onto the back foot this time, but the same result - no width to work with, and Taylor jabs the ball down into the crease. Excellent over for England
looped onto a good length, and pushed back down the pitch
driven with intent, but no way past mid-off - a hint of an attempt at a run, but wisely declined
expansive use of the feet, but in the end Taylor has no option but to defend with his pad. Clever variation of pace
lovely line and length again, Zimbabwe just beginning to drift now
turned around the corner and that's a chancy run, but they get away with it. Fortune favours etc ...
on off stump and tweaking away. Driven but without much timing to complete a tidy over

cracking control from Mascarenhas, and that could be game, set and match for England. A perfect legcutter, Taylor - frustrated by the slowing of the run-rate - swings across the line, and his stumps are shattered
drawn forward to yet another good length ball
on leg stump, flicked off the legs slightly airily, but safe
dropped, and that's an absolute and total howler from Pietersen at mid-off! A horribly mistimed lofted drive, looped into his hands, and straight out again ... well, well ...
massive appeal for lbw, turned down but that must have been mighty close. Meanwhile Pietersen is muttering to himself, as well he might. That was dreadful
nudged into the covers and an immediate call. Panic stations setting in a bit now, but another run ticked off
coolly flighted and tweaks a touch. Played respectfully into the covers

a fraction of width and Matsikenyeri goes down on one knee to thump that over the covers. But lurking on the boundary's edge is Andrew Flintoff, and he doesn't drop those. A fourth wicket falls, and Zimbabwe's challenge is ebbing away
a firm strike into the leg side, and another couple

another one bites the dust, and that's Schofield's second wicket in four balls. A hint of turn out of the rough, Chibhabha aimed to play across the line, and looped a leading edge straight back to the bowler
runs immediately, dabbed down to third man
down on one knee for the sweep, and picked up at backward square to complete a successful over for Schofield and England
wide of the crease, and angled into the right-hander. Clean through an attempted drive and through to the keeper
a touch of width, and carved down to backward point
tighter line and fuller length, but a flash of the blade sends that whistling out to the sweeper on the point boundary
an uncompromising slog picks up another single as Anderson leaps in a vain attempt to intercept the ball in his followthrough
walloped - stand-and-deliver stuff. It looked as though it was clean into the stands, but in the end it plugged in the soft outfield

fuller and tighter to complete the over. Zimbabwe's requirement is now approaching superhuman, but they can still be proud of their efforts today. The slower bowlers have put the squeeze on after a flying start
well, that'll help! Too full and too much width, and that is flat-batted high and handsomely over long-on
ambitious again, but not quite there for the shot this time

too short, but effective nonetheless. Chigumbura went for the maximum, but could only pick out Luke Wright, who was lurking ten yards in from the midwicket boundary. A flurry of wickets, and England are set for a comfortable victory now. With a wounded Australia to come tomorrow, that's just as well ...
floated onto a good length, and a lofted drive finds no-man's land at deep cover
nudged into the covers for a quick single
too short, and Masakadza swings across the line and connects sweetly. The ball fizzes through midwicket
dabbed into the off side and finds the gap well
an ambitious clunk of a shot, but Collingwood at mid-off cuts off the second
fuller length, angled into the pads and turned to backward square
full length but a foot outside off stump. Masakadza swings lustily down the ground, all along the ground, and long-off sweeps up
yorker, and a good one too. Not quite in the Newlands 2003 mould, but effective nonetheless
dropped. A big swish across the line, Collingwood the bowler hurtles out to midwicket to complete the return catch, but the ball sneaks through his fingers. Another miss in the field ...
drifts onto the pads, and an elegant leg-glance picks up four very useful runs
dobbly line and length, takes an eternity to reach the bat, but is eventually nudged to midwicket
outside off stump and down on one knee for the sweep, but there's no connection
drifts down the leg-side this time, and rightly called
yorker length but misdirected. Pietersen at fine leg does well to pull that in inside the rope, and Luke Wright wings the return in to the keeper
slow yorker, loops down the track and Utseya is deceived by the lack of pace
clubbed out to long-on, another jogged single
full and straight, dug out with a swish of the bat, and picked up in the covers
right up in the blockhole once again. Another expansive strike, but can't be timed
a short run-up this time from Flintoff - a useful trick that - and it's full and straight once again. Quality death bowling, but well played too, finding the gap down the ground
just a little bit too short this time. Utseya rocks back and has a heave over midwicket. Not timed, but reasonably effective in the circumstances
on the spot, and through to the keeper
biffed out to the covers, but can't beat the field
low full-toss and wide of off stump too. Utseya reaches for it with one hand, and scampers a single to midwicket

in the slot for a swing, but Masakadza can't get enough bat on it. It disappears high, high into the stratosphere, and lands safely in the hands of Luke Wright at deep midwicket. A useful innings comes to an end, as Dabengwa comes to the crease
a swing and a miss. A fraction slower from Broad, and Prior tidies up
full delivery clubbed down the ground, and that's the end of that
